alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 01 at 12:10PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...MISSOURI RIVER NEAR BISMARCK AND MANDAN ICING OVER... As of early Thursday afternoon, sheets of ice are continuing to work their way down through the Bismarck and Mandan reach of the Missouri River. Thus far, the river has only risen a few inches, but at some point between late Thursday and Friday evening, it is likely that the ice will begin to accumulate near the University of Mary and restrict flow in the river. As the river channel fills with immobile ice, the river above the immobile ice will see rapid increases in water levels. Since 2010, the river has risen between five and nearly eight feet during the first icing over event for the winter season, often in well under 24 hours. As of Thursday afternoon, the water level for the Missouri River at Bismarck is 4.2 feet. Given recent history, this would suggest the river will be at a stage of between roughly 9 feet and 12 feet once the river ice is in place. Flood stage at the Bismarck gage on the Missouri River is 14.5 feet. If you observe problematic high water, please report this to your local emergency management.
